oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Letter from Corporal Lorenzo Dow Atwood, Co. D, 43rd Wisc. Infantry Regiment, USA
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Written from the Union earthen fort and depot at Johnsonville -"a new place, probably not on the map"- he speaks of drawing "250 lbs of Beef and 90 lbs bread" from the "Comisary" and being marched "into a large building built for a machine shop on the banks of the Tenn. River." Says there are 6000 soldiers "at this Post now the Reb Forest is about 100 miles south of this place on the same river with 10,000 men.""A thousand rumors as to what we shall do are afloat in camp."
